job description:
POSITION SUMMARY STATEMENT:

To work as a member of a technical work team in the Clinical Laboratory including performance of laboratory tests in the section assigned; assist in the implementation of methodologies, participate in the training of new personnel and any student clinical rotations; assisting in the development and implementation of training programs for new personnel and students: to assist with directing personnel by serving as a charge tech; and to perform related duties as assigned.


MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS:
Education:

Bachelor’s degree in medical technology, biology, or other science related field or eligible; successful completion of a Clinical rotation in an approved program that qualifies for ASCP certification or equivalent preferred;

Advanced Degree or training (Masters in Sciences or Clinical Specialty) may substitute for preferred certification
Experience:

None
Knowledge, Skills

& Abilities:
  • Knowledge of principles, concepts and methodology sufficient to perform a broad range of tests, including forensic testing (i.e. chain of custody) in one or more areas of the clinical laboratory sections
  • Knowledge and skills to interpret the various clinical presentations of disease and apply such knowledge in conjunction with the Laboratory test findings to affect a timely and accurate diagnostic result
  • Knowledge sufficient to check correlation and validity of results
  • Knowledge and skills sufficient to select, adapt or design techniques to optimize the quality of specimen preparations
  • Knowledge of accrediting/regulatory agency requirements sufficiently to insure that work is consistent with quality assurance standards
  • Knowledge and skills sufficient to provide technical instructions and advise other departments on Clinical laboratory procedures
  • Ability to present instructional material in a logical, interesting and stimulating manner
  • Knowledge of computer technology and its application in the Clinical laboratory section
  • Knowledge of laboratory instrumentation sufficient to operate, maintain and perform limited repairs and recognize the need for major repairs or replacements
  • Ability to establish priorities in specimen processing according to laboratory guidelines and clinical considerations
  • Ability to assess adequacy of each sample, evaluate ancillary data provided and determine if additional information and/or testing is necessary, then implement the required procedures to affect a change
  • Knowledge of Regions organization policies and procedures and how to use the computer to inquire on these procedures and policies
  • Knowledge of general phlebotomy procedures if applicable

Licensure/Registration/Certification:

Medical Technologist (MT) or Medical Laboratory Scientist (MLS) Certification with ASCP or equivalent agency or eligible preferred.
